intro: Glomera transitoria, commonly known as the transient glomerate, is a rare flowering plant characterized by its unique inflorescence structure. It belongs to the family Apiaceae and is native to specific regions in southern Europe. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to those of other members of its family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
